intro: Weinmannia corocoroensis, commonly known as the Corocoro tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the family Weinmanniaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, mountainous environments at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a distinctive, fragrant scent to attract pollinators. The tree is valued for its hard, durable wood and is also an important component of the local ecosystem.
